intro: Cynorkis hispidula, commonly known as the hairy sandcatcher, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptive features for arid environments. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is well adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance and aiding in water retention. Cynorkis hispidula is often found in coastal and inland regions, where it thrives in full sun exposure.
